memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_FUNCTION DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::DiscreteToCartesian
memberdef.argsstring: (SplineType curvilinear_to_x, SplineType curvilinear_to_y, SplineEvaluator const &evaluator, IdxRangeRTheta idx_range_singular_point)
memberdef.name: DiscreteToCartesian

briefdescription.para: Instantiate a DiscreteToCartesian from the coefficients of 2D splines approximating the mapping.

detaileddescription.para: A discrete mapping is a mapping whose values are known only at the mesh points of the grid. To interpolate the mapping, we use B-splines. The DiscreteToCartesian mapping is initialised from the coefficients in front of the basis splines which arise when we approximate the functions $ x(r,\theta) $, and $ y(r,\theta) $ (with $ x $ and $ y $ the physical dimensions in the logical domain) with Splines (using SplineBuilder2D). Then to interpolate the mapping, we will evaluate the decomposed functions on B-splines (see DiscreteToCartesian::operator()).
Here, the evaluator is given as input.

parameterdescription.para: Bsplines coefficients of the first physical dimension in the logical domain.
Bsplines coefficients of the second physical dimension in the logical domain.
The evaluator used to evaluate the mapping.
The index range describing the points which should be used to evaluate functions at the central point.

memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_FUNCTION Coord< X, Y > DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::operator()
memberdef.name: operator()

briefdescription.para: Compute the physical coordinates from the logical coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: It evaluates the decomposed mapping on B-splines at the coordinate point with a SplineEvaluator2D.

parameterdescription.para: The coordinates in the logical domain.

simplesect.para: The coordinates of the mapping in the physical domain.

memberdef.type: KOKKOS_FUNCTION DTensor< VectorIndexSet< X, Y >, VectorIndexSet< R_cov, Theta_cov > >
memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_FUNCTION DTensor< VectorIndexSet< X, Y >, VectorIndexSet< R_cov, Theta_cov > > DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::jacobian_matrix
memberdef.name: jacobian_matrix

briefdescription.para: Compute full Jacobian matrix.

detaileddescription.para: For some computations, we need the complete Jacobian matrix or just the coefficients. The coefficients can be given independently with the function jacobian_component.

parameterdescription.para: The coordinate where we evaluate the Jacobian matrix.

memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION double DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::jacobian_component
memberdef.name: jacobian_component

briefdescription.para: Compute the (i,j) coefficient of the Jacobian matrix.

detaileddescription.para: For a mapping given by $ \mathcal{F} : {q_i}\mapsto {x_i} $, with ${q_i}$ the curvilinear coordinates and ${x_i}$ the Cartesian coordinates, the (i,j) coefficient of the Jacobian matrix is given by $ J^i_j\frac{\partial x_i}{\partial q_j} $.

As the mapping is decomposed on B-splines, it means it computes the derivatives of B-splines $ \frac{\partial x_i}{\partial q_j} (r,\theta)= \sum_k c_{x_i,k} \frac{\partial B_k}{\partial q_j}(r,\theta)$ (the derivatives are implemented in SplineEvaluator2D).

parameterdescription.para: The coordinate where we evaluate the Jacobian matrix.

simplesect.para: A double with the value of the (i,j) coefficient of the Jacobian matrix.

memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_FUNCTION double DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::jacobian
memberdef.name: jacobian

briefdescription.para: Compute the Jacobian, the determinant of the Jacobian matrix of the mapping.

parameterdescription.para: The coordinate where we evaluate the Jacobian.

simplesect.para: A double with the value of the determinant of the Jacobian matrix.

memberdef.type: KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION DTensor< VectorIndexSet< X, Y >, VectorIndexSet< R_cov, Theta_cov > >
memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION DTensor< VectorIndexSet< X, Y >, VectorIndexSet< R_cov, Theta_cov > > DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::first_order_jacobian_matrix_r_rtheta
memberdef.name: first_order_jacobian_matrix_r_rtheta

briefdescription.para: Get the first order expansion of the Jacobian matrix with the theta component divided by r. The expansion is carried out around $ r=0 $. The returned matrix $ J$ is defined as: $ J_{00} = \frac{\partial x}{\partial r}(r, \theta) $ $ J_{01} = \frac{1}{r} \frac{\partial x}{\partial \theta}(r, \theta) + O(r^2) = \frac{\partial^2 x}{\partial r \partial \theta}(0, \theta) $ $ J_{10} = \frac{\partial y}{\partial r}(r, \theta) $ $ J_{11} = \frac{1}{r} \frac{\partial y}{\partial \theta}(r, \theta) + O(r^2) = \frac{\partial^2 y}{\partial r \partial \theta}(0, \theta) $.

parameterdescription.para: The coordinate where we evaluate the Jacobian.

simplesect.para: The first order expansion of the Jacobian matrix with the theta component divided by r.

memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION IdxRangeRTheta DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::idx_range_singular_point
memberdef.name: idx_range_singular_point

briefdescription.para: Get the index range describing the points which should be used to evaluate functions at the central point.

simplesect.para: An index range covering the O-point.

memberdef.definition: KOKKOS_INLINE_FUNCTION const Coord< X, Y > DiscreteToCartesian< X, Y, SplineEvaluator, R, Theta, MemorySpace >::control_point
memberdef.name: control_point

briefdescription.para: Get a control point of the mapping on B-splines.

detaileddescription.para: The mapping $ (r,\theta) \mapsto (x,y) $ decomposed on B-splines can be identified by its control points $ \{(c_{x,k}, c_{y,k})\}_{k} $ where $ c_{x,k} $ and $ c_{y,k} $ are the B-splines coefficients:
where $ N_r\times N_{\theta} $ is the number of B-splines.

The control points can be obtained by interpolating the mapping on interpolation points (see GrevilleInterpolationPoints or KnotsAsInterpolationPoints). We can also note that the first control points $ \{(c_{x,k}, c_{y,k})\}_{k=0}^{N_{\theta}} $ are equal to the pole $ (c_{x,k}, c_{y,k}) = (x_0,y_0) $, $ \forall k = 0, ..., N_{\theta}-1 $ where $ x(0,\theta), y(0,\theta) = (x_0,y_0) $ $ \forall \theta $.

parameterdescription.para: The number of the control point.

briefdescription.para: A class for describing discrete 2D mappings from the logical domain to the physical domain.

detaileddescription.para: The mapping describe here is only defined on a grid. The DiscreteToCartesian class decomposes the mapping on B-splines to evaluate it on the physical domain.
This mapping could be costly to inverse.
